Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to explore coping strategies for feelings of loneliness, indicating a need for support in this area.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient typically reaches out to someone when feeling lonely, but sometimes this does not feel sufficient.
Psychosocial History: The patient has started engaging in social interactions, including conversations at a coffee shop and connections made in a painting class.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reports feeling proud of their progress in social situations and has shown improvement in emotional well-being.
Physiological Observations: The patient notes improved sleep consistency, sleeping better approximately 80% of the time.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making significant strides in social engagement and self-care practices.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to prepare conversation starters for social gatherings and explore local volunteer opportunities as a means to enhance fulfillment and connection.
Next Steps: The patient will research volunteer opportunities and set this as a goal for the upcoming week.
